title: Remembering Stanley Baxter: A Funny Actor's Life
summary: Stanley Baxter was a famous Scottish actor and comedian who lived to be 99 years old. He was born in Glasgow in 1926 and became a big star on British TV for many years. He acted in hit shows from the 1960s to the 1980s and was known for his funny sketches, like Parliamo Glasgow. He also performed in pantomimes, which are fun plays for families. Baxter won awards like Baftas for his work. He was a private person who didn't like being famous and gave few interviews. He passed away in a care home in London. This article tells us about his life and why people remember him as a great entertainer.
